definitions.definition: very tired, especially after you have been working hard or doing something for a long time

examples.text: Any chance of a drink? This weary traveller is about to collapse from thirst.
She suddenly felt old and weary.
He gave a long, weary sigh.
This war has made us all weary.

definitions.definition: making you feel tired or bored
no longer interested in or enthusiastic about something

examples.text: Students soon grow weary of listening to a parade of historical facts.
The people are weary of war.
I've grown rather weary of all your excuses.

wordOrigin: Old English wērig, wǣrig, of West Germanic origin.
